content:
• Monday, February 4, 2013
  • SIMO

    More on Silicon Motion: The chipmaker expects Q1 revenue to fall 15%-25% Q/Q, worse than a...

    More on Silicon Motion: The chipmaker expects Q1 revenue to fall 15%-25% Q/Q, worse than a consensus for a 4% drop. 2013 revenue is still expected to grow 10%-20% (consensus is for 13%), but investors appear skeptical. SIMO claims Q4 sales were hurt by "accelerated" Q3 shipments of 4G transceivers to Samsung, and declining retail memory card controller sales. A further decline in Samsung transceiver sales, along with a "rebalancing" of sales at an OEM customer, is expected in Q1. SIMO -11% AH. CC at 8AM ET tomorrow (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACHV

    OncoGenex Pharmaceuticals (OGXI) says that CFO Michelle Burris has resigned that position after...

    OncoGenex Pharmaceuticals (OGXI) says that CFO Michelle Burris has resigned that position after she and CEO Scott Cormack told the board last month about a developing personal relationship, which spurred directors to seek a transfer of executive duties. She'll serve as EVP of operations until March 31 and act as a consultant to the firm over the next year; the board tapped Cormack as Principal Financial Officer, Secretary and Treasurer, replacing Burris in those roles. Shares -3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:48 PM
  • CLDX

    Celldex Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CLDX) slips in the post session after announcing plans to sell $75M...

    Celldex Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CLDX) slips in the post session after announcing plans to sell $75M of stock in a secondary offering. All shares are being sold by the company, with Jefferies and Leerink Swann acting as joint book-running managers. Shares -3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) now -5.2% AH in response to its Q4 report, as investors show their concern...

    Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) now -5.2% AH in response to its Q4 report, as investors show their concern over the company's guidance and perhaps also a 3.1% Q/Q drop in revenue per online ad customer (a metric that has been rising for some time). Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) -0.6% after falling 5.1% in regular trading. Qihoo (NYSE:QIHU) -0.6% after rising 1.1% in regular trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • EPD

    Enterprise Products Partners (NYSE:EPD) is king of MLPs, and as the largest MLP raises cash and...

    Enterprise Products Partners (NYSE:EPD) is king of MLPs, and as the largest MLP raises cash and dilutes, Jon Ogg warns the other large MLPs and second-tier MLPs likely will follow suit, which could mean profit taking and possible near-term short selling are likely to come back as a temporary theme in the MLP sector. EPD, +11.8% YTD, -2.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM | 6 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +6%) steadily rallied today as investors continue piling in following a...

    Netflix (NFLX +6%) steadily rallied today as investors continue piling in following a blockbuster Q4 report and a positive reception to House of Cards. BMO raised its PT to $165 from $135, albeit while reiterating a Market Perform (the old target would've made Netflix a screaming buy 2 weeks ago). Meanwhile, The Atlantic's Rebecca Greenfield estimates Netflix will need to add 520.8K subs over the next 2 years on account of House of Cards to break even, and that HBO's track record suggests Netflix has a shot. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • JNY

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: JNY +5%. EDMC +5%. BRKS +5%. MM +5%. GFF +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: JNY +5%. EDMC +5%. BRKS +5%. MM +5%. GFF +4%.
    After-hours top losers: PC -10%. IDIX -7%. RTEC -6%. YUM -6%. BIDU -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • THO

    More on Thor Industries (NYSE:THO): announces preliminary sales for FQ2, saying that it expects...

    More on Thor Industries (NYSE:THO): announces preliminary sales for FQ2, saying that it expects to earn around $741M - handily topped topping consensus expectations of $714M by the Street - amid strong growth in sales of its recreational vehicles. RV sales improved 27% to $636.1M, while towables sales increased 18% to $522.4M. Sales of motorized RVs more than doubled to $113.7M, and bus sales improved by 9.7% over the prior year period. Shares +4.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • YUM

    More on Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) Q4 earnings: "Adverse publicity on poultry supply continues to...

    More on Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) Q4 earnings: "Adverse publicity on poultry supply continues to significantly impact China KFC sales." Indeed. Same-store sales in China for January and February off about 25% Y/Y. Shares -6.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 13 Comments
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) +1.6% AH after CEO John Riccitello discloses he recently bought 31K...

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) +1.6% AH after CEO John Riccitello discloses he recently bought 31K shares. The news comes shortly after EA rallied in the face of underwhelming FQ3 results and FQ4 guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLMS

    More on Calamos Asset Management (NASDAQ:CLMS) Q4 earnings: SA Pro author Thomas Lott tagged...

    More on Calamos Asset Management (NASDAQ:CLMS) Q4 earnings: SA Pro author Thomas Lott tagged Calamos as a classic "cigar butt" Buffett investment - not a fantastic business, but extremely cheap, loads of cash on the balance sheet, and awaiting a signal from management that it's interested in unlocking value. Is today's 3M share repurchase announcement a start?

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) slides 1.8% AH after announcing the receipt of a Notice of Default from a...

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) slides 1.8% AH after announcing the receipt of a Notice of Default from a law firm claiming to represent a majority of the holders of the company's 7.4% bonds due in 2037. Calling the notice "invalid and utterly without merit," J.C. Penney has filed an injunction enjoining the bond trustee from declaring an event of default. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • BIRT

    Actuate (NASDAQ:BIRT): Q4 EPS of $0.09 in-line. Revenue of $35.7M beats by $1.67M. Shares +3.4%...

    Actuate (NASDAQ:BIRT): Q4 EPS of $0.09 in-line. Revenue of $35.7M beats by $1.67M. Shares +3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • HIG

    More on Hartford Financial (NYSE:HIG) Q4 earnings: A $1.2B extraordinary dividend to the holding...

    More on Hartford Financial (NYSE:HIG) Q4 earnings: A $1.2B extraordinary dividend to the holding company from Hartford's CT-domiciled life insurance companies has been approved by regulators. The expected dissolution of company's Vermont life reinsurance captive is expected to return another $300M to the holding company. A wild AH ride for the shares had them as high as $27, now unchanged at $24.70. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • EPD

    Enterprise Products Partners (NYSE:EPD) -2.8% AH after announcing a public offering of 8M common...

    Enterprise Products Partners (NYSE:EPD) -2.8% AH after announcing a public offering of 8M common units. EPD plans to use the net proceeds for general partnership purposes, including repayment of debt, capital expenditures and acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 10 Comments
  • SYA

    Symetra Financial (NYSE:SYA): Q4 EPS of $0.24 misses by $0.1. Revenue of $520.8M beats by...

    Symetra Financial (NYSE:SYA): Q4 EPS of $0.24 misses by $0.1. Revenue of $520.8M beats by $4.38M. Shares +7.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • GILD

    More on Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q4 beats on all counts on double digit revenue growth....

    More on Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q4 beats on all counts on double digit revenue growth. Net earnings rose 15% Y/Y, driven by strong sales of its HIV drugs. Complera/Eviplera sales surged to $117.8M from $19.7M a year earlier, while sales of Atripla and Truvada improved 6% and 12%, respectively. Shares +3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • HIG

    Hartford Financial (NYSE:HIG): Q4 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $7.74B (up 37% Y/Y)...

    Hartford Financial (NYSE:HIG): Q4 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $7.74B (up 37% Y/Y) beats by $1.3B. Announces capital management plan to repurchase $500M in stock and reduce debt by $1B. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q4 EPS of $0.50 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.59B (+18% Y/Y)...

    Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q4 EPS of $0.50 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.59B (+18% Y/Y) beats by $140M. (PR). Shares +2.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • CLMS

    Calamos Asset Management (NASDAQ:CLMS): Q4 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.02. Revenues of $76.9M (down...

    Calamos Asset Management (NASDAQ:CLMS): Q4 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.02. Revenues of $76.9M (down 6.78% Y/Y) misses by $3.5M. Quarterly dividend increased to $0.125/share from $0.11. Repurchase program of 3M approved. Arthur Knight retires from board. James Boyne promoted to President and COO. Shares +7.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • HOLX

    Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX): FQ1 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $644.6M misses by $1.92M....

    Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX): FQ1 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $644.6M misses by $1.92M. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • NXPI

    NXP (NXPI -4.6%) closes with a sizable loss thanks to a general selloff in European equities,...

    NXP (NXPI -4.6%) closes with a sizable loss thanks to a general selloff in European equities, and an announcement the chipmaker's P-E investors plan to unload another 30M shares (12% of outstanding shares) through a secondary offering. The offering will reduce KKR's stake in NXP to 12.8% from 15.9%, Bain's to 10.2% from 12.7%, Silver Lake's to 5.1% from 6.3%., and Apax Partners' to 5.75% from 7.15%. (prospectus)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences (NYSE:EW): Q4 EPS of $0.9 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $510.5M (+18.7% Y/Y)...

    Edwards Lifesciences (NYSE:EW): Q4 EPS of $0.9 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $510.5M (+18.7% Y/Y) beats by $11.04M. Shares +1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • BDCO

    Blue Dolphin Energy (OTCQX:BDCO +10%) says its Board has formed a special committee comprised of...

    Blue Dolphin Energy (OTCQX:BDCO +10%) says its Board has formed a special committee comprised of three independent directors to conduct a strategic review of the feasibility of converting from a publicly-traded corporation to a publicly-traded master limited partnership.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • ANIP

    Biosante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) slips today after disclosing in a regulatory filing that it's...

    Biosante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) slips today after disclosing in a regulatory filing that it's sold all of its assets related to its GVAX cancer vaccine portfolio to Aduro BioTech, a clinical-stage immunotherapy company, for a $1M up front cash payment plus the potential for future royalty, milestone and sublicense payments.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPGI

    More on McGraw-Hill (MHP -14.5%): The expected suit follows the breakdown in talks between...

    More on McGraw-Hill (MHP -14.5%): The expected suit follows the breakdown in talks between S&P and the DOJ over the rating agency's AAA ratings on 30 CDOs in early 2007. The DOJ had reportedly sought "10 figures plus" and an admission of guilt. S&P: "(We) deeply regret that our CDO ratings failed to fully anticipate the rapidly deteriorating condition in the U.S. mortgage market ... a DOJ lawsuit would be entirely without factual or legal merit." Moody's (MCO -8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 20 Comments
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (DNR -1.4%) says estimated proved oil and natural gas reserves at year-end...

    Denbury Resources (DNR -1.4%) says estimated proved oil and natural gas reserves at year-end 2012 totaled 409M boe, consisting of 329M barrels of crude and NGL liquids and 482M cu. ft. of natural gas. DNR says tertiary proved reserves rose by 36%, and quarterly tertiary production increased by 8% Q/Q and 21% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • HLF

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -2%) regains some of its earlier losses, after the stock took a hit...

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -2%) regains some of its earlier losses, after the stock took a hit early on due to unconfirmed reports circulating of an investigation by the FTC. HLF denies the accusation, calling it "misleading and inaccurate."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • GLF

    Oil rigs are again heading into the Gulf of Mexico, and Barron's David Englander believes...

    Oil rigs are again heading into the Gulf of Mexico, and Barron's David Englander believes GulfMark Offshore (GLF +2.4%) is poised to take advantage of the industry resurgence. With GLF's key markets expected to strengthen and more new boats going into service, Englander sees its fleet commanding steadily higher rates and earnings jumping significantly.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD -2.2%) slips despite saying that topline results from two Phase 3 studies...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD -2.2%) slips despite saying that topline results from two Phase 3 studies of its nucleotide sofosbuvir met its endopoint among patients with chronic hepatitis C virus infection. Morgan Stanley reiterates its Overweight on the news, saying that additional Phase III data for sofosbuvir supports a "best in class" profile and a multi-billion dollar opportunity for GILD.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • NE

    Noble Corp.'s (NE -1.6%) proposed dividend increase to $1/year from $0.50 fails to receive a...

    Noble Corp.'s (NE -1.6%) proposed dividend increase to $1/year from $0.50 fails to receive a favorable review from all corners. UBS says NE likely would need to borrow to pay the dividend, since the company "is not generating free cash flow until 2014 and in 2013 will have to borrow again to complete the construction of its newly build program." Shareholder activism could have influenced the move, UBS adds.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • EBS

    Emergent Biosolutions (EBS -3%) slips after saying earlier today that Phase IIb trials of its...

    Emergent Biosolutions (EBS -3%) slips after saying earlier today that Phase IIb trials of its tuberculosis vaccine candidate, MVA85A, didn't provide statistically significant protection against the disease in infants who had been vaccinated at birth with a widely used vaccine. The company said data related to the trial were published Monday in the Lancet journal. The drug also failed to meet a secondary endpoint of protecting from infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis, the bacterium that causes tuberculosis.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -4.6%) is giving back a large chunk of the Friday gains it saw thanks to...

    Universal Display (PANL -4.6%) is giving back a large chunk of the Friday gains it saw thanks to favorable remarks at the CSIMA value investing conference. Aside from the general selloff in high-beta tech names, shares could be hurt by a Nikkei report highlighting interest from Apple and other tech companies in a new LCD optical film said to deliver better image quality than OLEDs. Synthetic fiber manufacturer Toyobo will begin making the film in April at a rate of 10K tons/year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • PKT

    In addition to Oracle/Acme Packet (previous), Procera (PKT +4.4%) is rallying thanks to a...

    In addition to Oracle/Acme Packet (previous), Procera (PKT +4.4%) is rallying thanks to a bullish coverage launch from Needham. The firm has set a $25 PT, and argues Procera's dedicated deep packet inspection (DPI) gear is taking share from router-integrated solutions provided by Cisco and others. Needham sees the DPI market growing at a 25%-35% clip on the back of surging Internet traffic for both mobile (50-100% growth) and wireline (30%-50%) networks. Q4 results arrive on Feb. 28.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • SNY

    Shares of European drug giant Sanofi (SNY -4%) slide today, despite announcing that the European...

    Shares of European drug giant Sanofi (SNY -4%) slide today, despite announcing that the European Commission has granted marketing authorization in Europe for its diabetes treatment Lyxumia. The drug is indicated for the treatment of adults with type 2 diabetes mellitus, and helps achieve glycemic control.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • SPGI

    McGraw-Hill (MHP -1.6%) slips lower after the WSJ reports that the Justice Department and state...

    McGraw-Hill (MHP -1.6%) slips lower after the WSJ reports that the Justice Department and state prosecutors intend to file civil charges against S&P in which wrongdoing at the unit's rating agency will be alleged.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • HPTX

    Hyperion Therapeutics (HPTX +34%) trades up today after winning FDA approval for its first drug,...

    Hyperion Therapeutics (HPTX +34%) trades up today after winning FDA approval for its first drug, Ravicti, for treatment of urea cycle disorder - a rare but potentially deadly genetic disorder that affects the urea cycle - in patients aged two and older. The drug removes ammonia from the blood which can't be removed naturally in people with urea cycle disorders. Ammonia in the body can travel to the brain and cause brain damage. The drug is expected to be commercially available in April.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • IMMR

    Immersion (IMMR +3.8%) catches a bid after announcing it has expanded its haptic feedback...

    Immersion (IMMR +3.8%) catches a bid after announcing it has expanded its haptic feedback technology licensing deal with LG Electronics to include basic haptic effects. LG already licenses Immersion's TouchSense tech, which covers more complex haptic effects. The expanded deal indicates Immersion's efforts to assert its basic haptics IP are paying off - shares took off in November after the company reached a basic haptics settlement with Motorola Mobility.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • BLRX

    Shares of BioLineRX (BLRX -15%) tank after the drug developer repeats its plan to report interim...

    Shares of BioLineRX (BLRX -15%) tank after the drug developer repeats its plan to report interim results from Phase II/III testing of its acute schizophrenia treatment BL-1020 during the week of March 18, amid speculation of less-than-stellar results. The interim analysis will be performed by a fully independent, external Data Monitoring Committee.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • HPTX

    Midday top 10 gainers: HPTX +31%. APKT +22%. EBOD +16%. OTC:PGRX +15%. SONS +14%. PC +11%. EDAP...

    Midday top 10 gainers: HPTX +31%. APKT +22%. EBOD +16%. OTC:PGRX +15%. SONS +14%. PC +11%. EDAP +9%. ORRF +10%. HMY +9%. TAOM +9%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: INUV -13%. CLSN -13%. SED -12%. CYTK -8%. VVI -9%. CTC -8%. PRIS -8%. PERI -8%. BLIN -8%. CFBK -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CLSN

    Celsion (CLSN -11.4%) sinks again today after noting in a SEC filing that it's entered into a...

    Celsion (CLSN -11.4%) sinks again today after noting in a SEC filing that it's entered into a Controlled Equity Offering Sales Agreement with Cantor Fitzgerald to sell $25M worth of shares, from time to time. The stock cratered last week on news that its liver cancer drug TheromDox had failed its latest clinical trials.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • SNMP

    Constellation Energy Partners (CEP +7.2%) plans to sell its Alabama assets of 500-plus operating...

    Constellation Energy Partners (CEP +7.2%) plans to sell its Alabama assets of 500-plus operating natural gas wells in the Robinsons Bend Field plus related leasehold interests and infrastructure. CEP anticipates net proceeds received in the transaction will be used to reduce debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell (MXWL +3.3%) trades higher in response to an upgrade to Overweight from Piper: the firm...

    Maxwell (MXWL +3.3%) trades higher in response to an upgrade to Overweight from Piper: the firm is raising its PT to $11.50 from $7, and expects sales of Maxwell's ultracapacitors to the Chinese hybrid bus market to grow in 2013. Though still well below its 52-week high of $21.20 (shares cratered in April following a poor Q1 report) , Maxwell has rallied a bit in recent months.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • ORAN

    Debt-laden European telcos are having a rough day following major declines in continental...

    Debt-laden European telcos are having a rough day following major declines in continental indices thanks to fresh Spanish and Italian woes. FTE -5.2%. TEF -4.7%. TI -5.7%. PT-OLD -5.8%. Vodafone (VOD -1.6%) is posting a relatively small decline in spite of being hit with a downgrade to Neutral from Citi.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • MRK

    Merck (MRK -1.9%) moves lower on a couple of downgrades today one from Morgan Stanley to...

    Merck (MRK -1.9%) moves lower on a couple of downgrades today one from Morgan Stanley to underweight and another from Leerink Swann to Market Perform. Morgan, who seems to be having the biggest adverse affect on the shares today, saying there's 75% chance that the large "Improve-It" study of its cholesterol drug Vytorin will fail. If that's the case, the stock could decline by double-digits on a percentage basis. Leerink cites uncertainty around odanacatib, as well as increasing competition for Januvia and Isentress as its motive for cutting the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE -2.1%) remains the world's top iron ore producer, but it's losing ground to Rio Tinto...

    Vale (VALE -2.1%) remains the world's top iron ore producer, but it's losing ground to Rio Tinto (RIO -2.2%) as its output growth stalls because of aging mines and licensing delays. Producers in Australia, where the bulk of Rio’s iron ore operations are, will be responsible for nearly all of this year's 6% global supply growth while Vale will be little changed, BB&T Capital says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • CYOU

    Sohu (SOHU -5.4%) and subsidiary Changyou (CYOU -4.2%) are lower following their Q4 reports....

    Sohu (SOHU -5.4%) and subsidiary Changyou (CYOU -4.2%) are lower following their Q4 reports. While Sohu beat Q4 estimates, Q1 guidance - revenue of $290M-$299M and EPS of $0.50-$0.55 vs. a consensus of $278.7M and $0.58 - is mixed. Changyou beat estimates and delivered solid Q1 guidance - revenue of $168M-$174M and EPS of $1.38-$1.44 vs. a consensus of $166.9M and $1.38 - but is still selling off. Sohu's search/other revenue rose 68% Y/Y thanks to share gains for Sogou. Total online ad sales +20%, online games +29%, wireless -13%. (Sohu PR) (Changyou PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • CLX

    Shares of Clorox (CLX +1.8%) cruise to new all-time highs after the company put in a strong FQ2...

    Shares of Clorox (CLX +1.8%) cruise to new all-time highs after the company put in a strong FQ2 and raises its outlook for FY13. A national outbreak of a flu epidemic helped drive up sales of the Clorox's cleaning products and disinfectant wipes during the most recent period.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • HMY

    Harmony Gold (HMY +7.3%) says its Q4 profit rose 28% as costs dropped and prices received for...

    Harmony Gold (HMY +7.3%) says its Q4 profit rose 28% as costs dropped and prices received for the metal climbed even as its biggest operation was shut due to strikes. Operating earnings rose to 1.58 rand/share vs. 1.23 rand/share in the prior quarter and the consensus estimate of 1.05. Gold output dropped 9% Q/Q due to work stoppages and violence at the Kusasalethu mine.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • UTHR

    United Therapeutics (UTHR +1.3%) moves up after its board authorizes an additional $420M to its...

    United Therapeutics (UTHR +1.3%) moves up after its board authorizes an additional $420M to its existing share repurchase program. The program will become effective on March 4 and remain open for up to one year. Separately, Standpoint Research ups the shares from Hold to Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • SCHW

    Schwab (SCHW -1.6%) is downgraded to Hold at UBS. "We are not convinced about broad-based...

    Schwab (SCHW -1.6%) is downgraded to Hold at UBS. "We are not convinced about broad-based re-risking into equities." The stock has had a big run higher, boosted by thoughts of retail's return to stocks, but also helped by the chance of rising rates. Schwab has been losing a relative fortune subsidizing clients in money market funds. A 3% Fed Funds rate would do wonders for profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • CSCO

    A slew of telecom hardware and software firms are higher following Oracle's deal to acquire Acme...

    A slew of telecom hardware and software firms are higher following Oracle's deal to acquire Acme Packet (I, II). The big winners include VoIP/unified communications software providers BroadSoft (BSFT +7.7%) and AudioCodes (AUDC +4.2%), and volatile deep packet inspection hardware plays Allot (ALLT +4.6%) and Procera (PKT +5.9%). Juniper (JNPR +1.4%), F5 (FFIV +1.2%), and Ciena (CIEN +1.6%) are also higher - Juniper is the frequent subject of M&A speculation, but its $11.7B market cap poses a challenge. (Sonus and Riverbed)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • SNP

    Sinopec (SNP -6.8%) reveals plans to raise HK$24B ($3.1B) in a placement of 2.85B Hong...

    Sinopec (SNP -6.8%) reveals plans to raise HK$24B ($3.1B) in a placement of 2.85B Hong Kong-listed shares at HK$8.45 each. Dealing with substantial debt isn't the only item clouding SNP's outlook: It is bearing some of the responsibility for cleaning up Beijing's foul air. Chairman Fu Chengyu says SNP will invest ~30B yuan/year ($4.8B) to improve its refiners, up from an average ~20B annually for the last decade.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • YOKU

    Youku Tudou (YOKU -5.8%) gives back some of the big gains it has seen since early December...

    Youku Tudou (YOKU -5.8%) gives back some of the big gains it has seen since early December following a downgrade to Sell from Maxim Group, which thinks losses will grow in 2013 thanks to the integration of Tudou's ops. The sell-side is currently expecting Youku's EPS loss to decline by over 50% this year, albeit while remaining substantial.

  • FB
